means: [医]局限的：受限制或限于有限空间的
在…周围划线( circumscribe的过去式和过去分词 )

word_mean: 局限的：受限制或限于有限空间的

sentence.Network_en: The power of the monarchy was circumscribed by the new law.
sentence.Network_cn: 君主统治的权力受到了新法律的制约。

sentence.Network_en: His activities have been severely circumscribed since his illness.
sentence.Network_cn: 自生病以来他的行动一直受到严格的限制.

sentence.Network_en: The army evidently fears that, under him, its activities would be severely circumscribed.
sentence.Network_cn: 军方显然担心在他的领导下，其活动将受到严重制约。

entry.def: If someone's power or freedom is circumscribed, it is limited or restricted.

example.ex: The army evidently fears that, under him, its activities would be severely circumscribed...
example.tran: 军方显然担心在他的领导下，其活动将受到严重制约。

example.ex: There are laws circumscribing the right of individual citizens to cause bodily harm to others.
example.tran: 有多项法律限制公民的权利，使其不得对他人进行人身伤害。

means.word_mean: 1. subject to limits or subjected to limits

sentences.sentence: "it is impossible to specify a clearly circumscribed (or delimited) area for any particular science"

auth_sentence.content: To play lawn-tennis...in the exceedingly circumscribed court.
auth_sentence.res_content: To play lawn-tennis...in the exceedingly circumscribed court.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To play lawn-tennis...in the exceedingly circumscribed court.

auth_sentence.content: This because we confine our empirical approach to a circumscribed envrionment.
auth_sentence.res_content: This because we confine our empirical approach to a circumscribed envrionment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This because we confine our empirical approach to a circumscribed envrionment.

auth_sentence.content: Instead our tenacious environment specialist Roger Harrabin got the gig, on the circumscribed area of climate change.
